document.heading: Mayor's Anti-Animal Abuse Advisory Commission - Amendments
An Ordinance Concerning Mayor's Anti-Animal Abuse Advisory Commission - Amendments

para.text: The Advisory Commission consists of 15 members.
Of these:
7 members are appointed by the Mayor in accordance with Article IV, § 6 of the Baltimore City Charter; and
8 members are ex-officio members.

para.heading: Appointed members.
para.text: The 7 appointed members of the Advisory Commission are as follows:
2 members representing:
animal rescue groups; or
animal advocacy organizations;
2 at-large members, nominated by the Mayor;
1 member of the City Council, nomimated by the President of the City Council, and;
2 at-large members, nominated by the President of the City Council.

para.heading: Ex-officio members.
para.text: The 8 ex-officio members are the following, or their designated representatives:
the Mayor;
the President of the City Council;
the State's Attorney for Baltimore City;
the Baltimore City Sheriff;
the Police Commissioner;
the Health Commissioner;
the Director of the Bureau of Animal Control; and
the Chief Executive Officer, Executive Director, or Director of an animal shelter operating within the boundaries of the City.

para.heading: Appointment without regard to political affiliation.
para.text: The appointment of members must be made without regard to political affiliation.
The Advisory Commission shall meet at least 2 times each calendar year.
The Advisory Commission may hold additional meetings, at the call of the Chair, as frequently as required to perform its duties.
A majority of the members of the Advisory Commission constitutes a quorum for the transaction of business.
An affirmative vote by the majority of a quorum is needed for any official action.

para.heading: Rules of procedure.
para.text: The Advisory Commission may adopt rules of procedure to govern its meetings and procedures.

para.heading: Failure to attend meetings.
para.text: If any member is absent from regularly scheduled meetings more than 1 time in 1 year, not counting absences excused by the Chair:
the member is considered to have resigned; and
the Chair must request that the member's appointing authority fill the resultant vacancy.

para.heading: Staff.
para.text: The City Health Department shall provide adequate staff for the Advisory Commission to carry out its duties.

para.heading: Volunteers.
para.text: The Advisory Commission may engage the services of volunteer workers, without salary.

para.heading: Budget.
para.text: The Advisory Commission may expend funds as authorised in the Ordinance of Estimates.
